intro: Pilea ciliata, commonly known as the Chinese money plant, is a compact, evergreen shrub native to China. It features glossy, round, fleshy leaves that resemble small coins, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters during the spring. It thrives in bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening. Pilea ciliata is relatively low maintenance and can be propagated easily through stem cuttings.
